overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting with limited historical records (96 hourly points). It systematically evaluates multiple methods before selecting a simple averaging technique due to data constraints, focusing on daily seasonality while acknowledging the challenge of capturing longer patterns with minimal data. The solution prioritizes robustness and simplicity, with thorough data validation and rounding for consistency.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in provided data
Absence of strong trend over 4-day period
key_insights: Prioritization of daily seasonality (24-hour patterns) as the dominant feature for forecasting
Explicit handling of data limitations: rejection of complex models (ARIMA/ETS) due to insufficient historical data
Validation of data completeness before processing
Hourly averaging across multiple days to smooth daily patterns
Consistent output formatting (timestamp alignment and 3-decimal rounding)
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with strong emphasis on data constraints: combines seasonality analysis, multi-method evaluation, and practical simplification. Includes detailed data examination but avoids advanced statistical modeling due to limited data scope.
